[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: index] [Index manipulation] Can the index field be manipulated to point to unburned tokens, allowing false burn events that don't correspond to actual burns? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Concurrent burns] In parallel execution mode (Block-STM), can concurrent burns of different tokens in the same collection cause race conditions in Burn event emission ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Read-write conflicts] Can read operations on collection supply conflict with Burn event emissions in concurrent transactions, causing non-deterministic event ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Atomic emission] Is Burn event emission atomic with the token deletion and supply decrement, or can partial failures leave inconsistent state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: token] [Invalid addresses] Can token addresses be set to special system addresses (0x0, 0x1, 0x3, 0x4) causing undefined behavior in token operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: collection] [Collection existence] Does the collection address in Burn events guarantee that the collection resource exists at that address, or can events reference deleted collections? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: token] [Address collision] Can token addresses collide with collection addresses or other object addresses, causing confusion in event processing and indexing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: collection] [Module address] Does collection address validation ensure it matches TOKEN_OBJECTS_ADDRESS namespace, or can cross-module address confusion occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Event ordering guarantees] Can Burn events from different transactions in the same block be processed in non-deterministic order, causing race conditions in indexers and analytics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Event uniqueness] Is there a unique identifier for each Burn event beyond the token address, or can duplicate events for the same token cause processing errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Missing events] Can certain error conditions cause Burn events to be silently dropped without emission, leading to supply tracking desynchronization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Memory allocation] Does creating large numbers of Burn events in a single transaction cause excessive memory allocation that could lead to OOM conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Clone overhead] Are Burn structs cloned unnecessarily during event emission, causing performance degradation or memory exhaustion in high-throughput scenarios? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Reference lifetime] Can references to Burn event data outlive their valid lifetime, causing use-after-free or dangling pointer issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Supply manipulation] Can false Burn events be used to artificially decrease reported collection supply, manipulating market prices and deceiving buyers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Reward calculation] If burn events affect reward distribution or staking calculations, can manipulated events be used to steal rewards or manipulate yields? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Royalty bypass] Can burn events be used to bypass royalty payments that should trigger on ownership transfers, causing financial loss to creators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Market manipulation] Can coordinated emission of fake Burn events be used for pump-and-dump schemes or other market manipulation tactics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Gas metering] Is Burn event emission properly gas-metered, or can attackers emit unlimited events to exhaust validator resources without paying proportional gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Transaction limits] Can a single transaction emit more Burn events than the gas limit should allow, bypassing transaction resource limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Gas consistency] Is gas charged for Burn event emission consistent across all validators, or can gas calculation differences cause consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Module isolation] Can malicious modules outside token_objects emit Burn events by exploiting the public MoveEventV2Type trait implementation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Friend function bypass] Can non-friend modules call functions that emit Burn events by exploiting visibility rules or friend function vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Type system bypass] Can Move's type system be bypassed to create Burn events without going through the legitimate token::burn flow? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: index] [Snapshot staleness] When index is read from aggregator_v2::read_snapshot(), can the snapshot contain stale data causing burn events with incorrect index values? (High)
